title: The Death First Class
text: At beginning November  Singapore Airlines Ltd  announced world s luxurious  fully enclosed first class seat  Passengers expect best  bedding  for two  desired  embroidered Lalique  dinner served Wedgewood  32 inch HD screen  two bathrooms full sized wardrobe  Just ten days later  Dubai based Emirates Airline Ltd  sought outdo Southeast Asian giant first class suite featuring hardwood floors  mood lighting  kelp infused moisturizing pajamas design details inspired Mercedes Benz S Class  The high end one upmanship would appear herald new golden age luxury air travel  least able afford tickets cost excess  10 000 per passenger  In fact  first class cabins shrinking two decades least  pressure increasingly competitive  price focused global airline industry changing demographics flying  Those trends set accelerate  The latest luxury suites may look futuristic  it s clear first class future all  The idea first class harkens back half century so called Golden Age Air Travel  passenger seating overall less cramped  food  allegedly  better  sleeper berths common sweatpants weren t acceptable attire travel  Multi class cabins  first introduced 1950s  put price  golden  experience  The launch Boeing 747 1969 introduced even lavish world high flyers included bars lounges  world class cuisine fat sleeper seats  Airline deregulation late 1970s early 1980s began changing financial equation  By mid 1980s  caught brutal price wars  U S  carriers struggling keep offering first class levels service reduced prices  One solution  Leave first class seats empty give away free upgrades valued customers  As recently 2011  14 percent Delta Air Lines Inc s first class seats paid for  rest flew empty upgraded passengers  From business standpoint  that s terribly good use plane s valuable real estate  The solution  devised mid 1970s  business class  As first deployed  offered full fare paying customers slightly higher level service discounted tickets  Eventually  business class grew luxurious  began cannibalize first class  That s going continue  For lower still expensive fares  business travelers enjoy amenities would ve considered first class years ago  including lie flat beds  better food   increasingly   door privacy  More important  it s possible stuff business class seats first class seats amount space  making business class winner airlines  too  Despite hype around new first class suite  even Singapore Airlines reducing number suites fleet 50 percent  boosting number business class seats 10 percent   11 planes   30 percent  Likewise  even Emirates touts hyper luxury suites  plans offer six barely nine planes end 2019   less 4 percent fleet  For better idea Emirates sees future  look record setting 615 seat plane started flying 2015  Those planes won t offer first class all  Among big three U S  carriers  Delta phased international first class altogether  United ending 2018 American offers small handful flights  Elsewhere world  airlines including Cathay Pacific  Lufthansa  Air India  Qantas reducing number first class seats routes they re available  As global aviation becomes competitive  greater numbers passengers developing regions take first flights  pressure keep prices increase  Celebrities recluses willing fork thousands dollars private suite probably always first class option flights global financial centers  But people likely content business class   money private jet  Airlines use first class suites largely marketing opportunities buff brand  even pack seats planes  For world  class matter future cattle class  This column necessarily reflect opinion editorial board Bloomberg LP owners

title: FCC Plans December Vote Kill Net Neutrality Rules
text: The U S  Federal Communications Commission next month planning vote kill Obama era rules demanding fair treatment web traffic may decide vacate regulations altogether  according people familiar plans  The move would reignite years long debate seen Republicans broadband providers seeking eliminate rules  Democrats technology companies support them  The regulations passed 2015 bar broadband providers AT T Inc  Comcast Corp  interfering web traffic sent Google  Facebook Inc  others  FCC Chairman Ajit Pai  chosen President Donald Trump  April proposed gutting rules asked public reaction  The agency taken 22 million comments matter  Pai plans seek vote December  said two people asked identified matter hasn t made public  As head Republican majority  likely win vote whatever proposes  One people said Pai may call vacating rules except portions mandate internet service providers inform customers practices   one severe options would please broadband providers  They argue FCC s rules aren t needed discourage investment  part subject companies complex unpredictable regulations  Democrats technology companies say rules needed make sure telecommunications providers don t favor business partners harm rivals  Why Republicans Want Nix U S  Net Neutrality Rules  QuickTake The agency declined comment timing vote   We don t anything report point  said Tina Pelkey  spokeswoman commission  Pai April proposed FCC end designation broadband companies common carriers  That would remove legal authority underpins net neutrality rules  Pai could also choose find authority FCC s powers promote broadband  That would leave rules without apparent legal footing  leading turn conclusion agency lacks authority even issue revised  less stringent regulations  The April proposal also asked agency consider lifting bans blocking web traffic building  fast lanes  favor willing pay faster service  Immediate Reaction News December vote drew immediate reactions   Abandoning bipartisan net neutrality principles threatens kill streaming revolution hurt businesses  large small  migrating cloud record speeds  said Chip Pickering  chief executive officer Incompas trade group members including online shopping giant Amazon com Inc  video streamer Netflix Inc   Chairman Pai s affection AT T Comcast holds great political risk President Trump entire Republican Party  Pickering said emailed statement   No one wants see internet turned cable pay streaming services love  Commissioner Mignon Clyburn  part FCC s Democratic minority  said agency headed  destructive path  doesn t help consumers   What consumers want access free open internet without fear throttled assessed toll broadband service provider  Clyburn said emailed statement  Tech s Agenda Trump s Washington  QuickTake Scorecard The current regulations forbid broadband providers blocking slowing web traffic  charging higher fees return quicker passage networks  Supporters rules say needed keep network owners unfairly squelching rivals discouraging web startups  Critics say rules discourage investment exposing companies threat heavier regulation including pricing mandates  marketplace competition discipline broadband providers  The regulation survived court challenge broadband providers last year  Trump s White House opposed rules  In July  Pai s critics protested  White House spokesman said administration  supports FCC s efforts roll back burdensome  monopoly era regulations    With assistance Jennifer Epstein

title: Domestic violence tragedy  It s predictor mass murder
text: Skip Skip x Embed x Share CLOSE Texas Public Safety authorities say Sutherland Springs church shooting appears stemmed  domestic situation  It s first domestic incident involving suspected gunman Devin Kelley  USA TODAY Well meaning experts risk credibility asserting link domestic abuse mass shootings  Statistics simply don t back up  Sutherland Springs Baptist Church Texas Eric Gay  AP  Photo  Eric Gay  AP  The gun pointing predictably shifted finger pointing since Texas church shooting 25 parishioners killed  including pregnant woman whose unborn baby also died  many others wounded  Could atrocity prevented better follow through gunman s history violence  included abuse ex wife stepson  The horrific nature crime gave advocates various causes opportunity push well meaning agendas  The gunman s violent past especially telling experts domestic violence  More  Will concealed carry stop next Sutherland Springs slaughter gun toting Texas  More  The day Sutherland Springs massacre  I went buy gun  I got lesson instead  Appearing PBS NewsHour day shooting  Deborah Epstein  co director Domestic Violence Clinic Georgetown University Law Center  claimed strong correlation domestic violence mass shootings   If look mass shootings occurred U S  soil  said Epstein   the vast majority committed people perpetrated domestic violence intimate partner  series intimate partners  process dealing domestic violence  In one week follow up story church shooting  headline San Antonio Express News read   Are mass killings domestic violence linked  It depends ask  You would think determination would matter fact  opinion  Unfortunately  media version children s game telephone  message easily misinterpreted gets repeated one news source another   There obvious link mass shootings domestic violence  suggested Susan Higginbotham  Executive Director Pennsylvania Coalition Against Domestic Violence  She least cited evidence   A study last year Everytown Gun Safety  used FBI data media reports analyze mass shootings January 2009 December 2016  showed 54  perpetrators horrific mass killings history domestic family violence  Higginbotham partially correct  misconstruing important point  The Everytown study indeed find 54  mass shootings involved intimate partners family members victims  In majority  however  domestic violence mass shooting family members  necessarily history previous domestic violence  Everytown s case summaries 156 shootings 2009 2016  in four victims killed  reveal 85 incidents gunman murdered least current former intimate partners family members  Of these  41  preceded acts domestic violence  Among entire pool mass shootings  25  revealed indication prior domestic violence  Even majority mass shootings preceded violence intimate partners family  still would hardly serve reliable predictor mass murder  There are  unfortunately  least 10 million incidents domestic violence every year  according estimates reported National Coalition Against Domestic Violence  By contrast  are  average  22 mass shootings annually least four fatalities  Were predict mass murder basis domestic violence  would wrong well 99  time  More  Chris Matthews  RFK came around pushing gun control  We too  POLICING THE USA  A look race  justice  media To clear  domestic violence serious concern causes significant emotional physical pain  sometimes escalates murder  It never ignored taken lightly  We need whatever possible prevention strategies terms socializing children intervention efforts  including arrest gun confiscation  occur  This right thing do  let s get straight concerning why  There least 10 million reasons elevate vigilance responding domestic violence  We shouldn t need occasional mass killing assailant charged spousal family abuse motivate us  I applaud efforts dedicated folks made domestic violence prevention focal point careers  But please don t diminish credibility abusing data make case  James Alan Fox title: Texas church massacre Clinton  Obama administrations
text: They warned Pentagon s failure report gun background check system  Where urgency  Our view A memorial First Baptist Church Sutherland Springs  Texas  Nov  12  2017  includes 26 white chairs Holcombe  weeks born  died well  They re victims church massacre Texas might never happened Clinton Obama administrations reacted urgency warnings flaws gun buyer background check system enacted 1993  Under federal law  shooter s 2012 court martial conviction assaulting then wife cracking skull infant prohibited purchasing gun  But Devin Kelley passed background checks bought firearms Air Force according recent IG report 2015  Navy  Air Force Marine Corps failed transmit FBI fingerprints final outcomes 30  sample 1 100 cases  Was anybody Pentagon reading reports  Or read nothing  The holes originally discovered Clinton administration  system remained porous President Obama office  Both presidents made preventing gun violence top priority  Obama mourned innocents murdered called stricter gun control heart breaking number mass shootings  But took January 2016  year left office  order database overhaul  The executive order called hiring 230 new background check examiners address Defense Department s omissions  Starting August 2016  database availability increased 24 hours day  FBI says can t provide number new examiners hired  One mistake  many victims The three FBI background check databases contain millions records  Over 16 years  ending December 2014  nearly 1 2 million people prohibited buying guns  The system works records check  Every missed opportunity potential tragedy  Each name  like Annabelle Pomeroy  14 year old daughter pastor Sutherland Springs  First Baptist Church  In 2015  white supremacist Dylann Roof purchased gun   one stopped buying   later used kill worshipers church Charleston  S C  A breakdown background check  loophole allows purchase denial isn t issued three days  let Roof get hands gun  That one failing left behind names nine victims  including Rev  Clementa Pinckney  President Obama gave eulogy funeral  Deeper data problems Domestic violence convictions even civilian courts present set problems making FBI system  For example  defendants prohibited buying guns conviction misdemeanor assault notes domestic violence  That information often missing  Disqualifying mental health records often aren t transmitted either  though title: Utah cop fired arresting nurse wouldn t draw blood
text: Skip Skip x Embed x Share CLOSE Police body camera video shows nurse Salt Lake City taken hospital handcuffed refusing draw blood unconcious patient  Police officials apologized say incident investigation   Sept  1  AP This screengrab video provided Salt Lake City police  shows University Hospital Salt Lake City nurse Alex Wubbels handcuffed police officers   Photo  Salt Lake City Police  A Utah police detective filmed forcefully handcuffing nurse refused draw patient s blood fired  Salt Lake City Police spokesman said Tuesday  Detective Jeff Payne arrested Alex Wubbels refused allow police take blood unconscious patient injured car accident  Body cam footage July 26 incident went viral became public September  sparking outrage across social media  In video  Wubbels explains officers needed warrant patient couldn t consent  Payne appears grow tired listening Wubbels objections  saying   We re done here  We re done  shoving door handcuffing her  Wubbels held police car  later freed without charges  More  Hospital CEO nurse arrest video   This happen again  Gordon Crabtree  CEO University Utah Hospital Salt Lake City  later said hospital security intervened changed hospital policy police officer speak senior nurse supervisors   To nurses staff   happen again  Crabtree said   Nurse Wubbels placed unfair unwarranted position  and  actions nothing less exemplary   I feel betrayed  I feel angry  I feel lot things  Wubbels said news conference video s release   I still confused  I m health care worker  The job I keep patients safe  Payne s lawyer  Greg Skordas  said plans appeal decision  Skordas said Tuesday Payne would still job video arrest hadn t gone viral  He said Payne would agree punishment termination going far  Payne s supervisor  Lt  James Tracy  demoted officer  Associated Press reported  Tracy made impulsive decision ordering Payne arrest Wubbels without first taking time understand facts situation law  Salt Lake City police chief Mike Brown wrote disciplinary letter  He said order created chaos unnecessarily escalated situation   Your lack judgment leadership matter unacceptable  result  I longer believe retain leadership position department  Brown said  The letter said Wubbels told investigators Tracy minimized concerns  intimidated lectured her  made feel like blame events  The Associated Press obtained disciplinary letters Payne Tracy public records request  Read Share story  https usat ly 2wMYHti

title: Future Home Of The Living God  Is A Rare Stumble From A Great Writer
text: Future Home Of The Living God  Is A Rare Stumble From A Great Writer Louise Erdrich is  without doubt  one America s greatest novelists  Her genius evident early career   1984 debut novel  Love Medicine  drew considerable critical acclaim earned National Book Critics Circle Award  In following years  finalist Pulitzer Prize The Plague Doves  National Book Award The Round House  She s proved brilliant writer almost anything   Almost  key word here  Erdrich s gift innovation paid past  latest novel  Future Home Living God  overreaching  frequently bizarre book never really comes close getting ground  It s going tarnish Erdrich s unbelievably accomplished career   it s hard imagine anything that  short body slamming Philip Roth setting fire Library Congress   demonstrate even country s best writers stumble every while  Future Home Living God  apparently set near future  follows Cedar Hawk Songmaker  generically quirky 26 year old Native American woman living Minnesota  Her adoptive parents  Minneapolis liberals   happily married vegans  distaste religion runs counter Cedar s recently acquired intellectual brand Catholicism  She s recently made contact birth mother  lives reservation Cedar s meth addled half sister  character   well  quasi plot device   disappears much novel  resurface later reasons unclear  Cedar s life happy enough  encounters two pieces surprising news  The first she s pregnant  The second America fast way becoming hellish nightmare dystopia  biological evolution starting reverse religious totalitarian movement aiming take control government  The timing couldn t worse Cedar  Babies started born unusual characteristics  shadowy government squads imprisoning pregnant women  hoping figure what s causing terrifying changes  Cedar forced lie low parents Phil  father unborn child  warns her   They re offering rewards anyone turns pregnant neighbor  acquaintance  family member  whatever  Cedar s freedom doesn t last long  rest Future Home Living God tells story desperate attempts escape hospital she s imprisoned  Erdrich  ever  gifted pacing  novel structure successful thriller  But that s essentially going it  The writing oddly flat  occasionally inexplicable  In one section  Erdrich dedicates paragraph Cedar s grocery shopping  she likes apples wheat crackers  somehow turns even boring sounds  It seems like it s meant humanize Cedar  fondness mozzarella cheese isn t substitute real character development  curiously lacking novel  Erdrich s gift innovation paid past  latest novel   overreaching  frequently bizarre book never really comes close getting ground  Too much novel reads like stoned dorm room philosophizing  Erdrich s writing pretty  it s often unclear exactly she s talking about   Evolution starts  miracle  reads one passage   Evolution stops  miracle  Life follows pattern vastness around us  The universe expanding contracting timeless time  It s poetic way  unfortunately  way  prog rock band B side 1976  The frustrating part Future Home Living God  however  Erdrich s failure explain exactly what s going on  It s never really clear  even end novel  happened cause reversal evolution  or  indeed  even means  The vagueness certainly intentional  it s also inexplicable  makes novel nearly impossible parse   The first thing happens end world don t know happening  writes  But neither text: Screenwriters claim presented screenplay 1999 The Walt Disney Company called  Pirates Caribbean  suing Disney Enterprises U S  District Court Denver claiming copyright infringement  The federal case filed Tuesday behalf screenwriters Arthur Lee Alfred II Ezequiel Martinez producer Tova Laiter Colorado Springs attorneys Elizabeth Thomas  Ryan Gillman Gregory Maceau  The plaintiffs  live film school  ecstatic work defendants  lawsuit says  As attorneys worked contract  plaintiffs trusted Disney  lawsuit says  Between October 1999 October 2000  worked Disney s creative team  Red Hood  Alfred Martinez also developed idea separate screenplay entitled  Pirates Spanish Main  They later retitled  Pirates Caribbean  Alfred Martinez realized Disneyland ride name  no story  behind it  They Caribbean   had treatment script  But Alfred Martinez met Disney employees discuss  Red Hood  saw screenplay  Pirates Caribbean  coffee table  They quickly ushered office returned  screenplay longer title: Danica Roem s win proved value unlimited campaign contributions
text: Last week  Virginia became first state nation elect openly transgender state legislator  Democrat Danica Roem defeated Republican Robert Marshall  longtime delegate called Virginia s  chief homophobe  introduced bill regulate use bathrooms  Roem s victory shows fast things change politics  But also makes broader point political campaign rules  Strict regulations campaign contributions necessarily make political systems equal diverse  Roem outraised Marshall 3 to 1 thanks part large donations lesbian  gay  bisexual transgender advocates across country  This possible Virginia one handful states imposes limits contribute  much  political candidate  Conventional wisdom suggests  money politics  rich man s game  wealthiest always find way around regulations make impact  It s grass roots   outsiders unfamiliar politics   suffer complicated campaign finance laws  If new political movements gain traction  states need make easy candidates organize  raise funds speak voters  The harder campaign  advantages shift incumbents well connected political operatives  Roem s success shows outsiders benefit lighter touch  Chris Abele  county executive Milwaukee chair Gay   Lesbian Victory Fund  personally contributed  190 000 Roem s campaign  In fact  Roem said Abele gave  50 000 check response President Donald Trump s announcement banning transgender individuals serving military  In 11 states  Abele s political expression would exceeded contribution limits prohibited law  More half states limit contributions state legislative candidates  5 000 less per election cycle  For Roem  similar restrictions Virginia would meant saying goodbye  500 000 five  six figure contributions campaign  almost two thirds total fundraising haul  Roem raised  779 289 total  Virginia impatient democracy try change rules game engineer outcomes want  We reject pessimism  Who would expected someone Danica Roem win Virginia s rules  Without extensive regulation political process  many argue  government doomed dominated economically powerful   typically understood old  white men  Good news  Reality bleak  Virginia s freedom candidates donors allowed Roem harness power national LGBT title: MLB Awards  Indians ace Corey Kluber wins 2017 AL Cy Young award
text: Wednesday night  MLB Baseball Writers Association America announced Cleveland Indians right hander Corey Kluber 2017 American League Cy Young Award  Red Sox lefty Chris Sale finished second voting Yankees righty Luis Severino finished third  Over National League side  Nationals ace Max Scherzer named 2017 NL Cy Young award winner  This second career Cy Young Kluber  award back 2014  He also finished third voting last season  Also  fourth time past 11 seasons Indians pitcher AL Cy Young  CC Sabathia 2007  Cliff Lee 2008  Kluber 2014 2017  For much season Sale considered front runner Cy Young award  faded stretch Kluber surged  swung vote favor  Here s quick comparison seasons  Sale first half  2 75 ERA  0 90 WHIP  8 09 K BB 127 2 3 innings Kluber second half  2 80 ERA  0 99 WHIP  5 13 K BB 93 1 3 innings Sale second half  3 12 ERA  1 07 WHIP  6 19 K BB 86 2 3 innings Kluber second half  1 79 ERA  0 77 WHIP  11 83 K BB 110 1 3 innings Kluber led pitchers  AL NL  wins  18  ERA  2 25  ERA   202  WHIP  0 87  K BB ratio  7 36  WAR  8 0  2017  He marvelous year especially late season  Kluber first pitcher Indians franchise history win multiple Cy Youngs  Sale excellent season   became first AL pitcher 300 plus strikeouts since Pedro Martinez 1999   though wasn t enough take home first career Cy Young  He s finished top six voting last six years  though first time he s runner up  Severino  meanwhile  broke monster 2017 season  throwing 193 1 3 innings 2 98 ERA  152 ERA  230 strikeouts  He s first Yankees starter finish sub 3 00 ERA since Andy Pettitte David Cone 1997  As reminder  voting major awards takes places regular season postseason  These regular season awards only  The full 2017 AL Cy Young voting results seen BBWAA s site

title: Whitney Cummings  I Didn t Understand Money So I Stopped Calling It Money
text: It s pretty surreal I m writing Money magazine given life  I knew absolutely nothing money  except waste it  My brother went work renowned bank  I m assuming nobody taught money I girl maybe tiny female brain couldn t handle big  fancy numbers  Whatever reason  time I 25  I realized I financially illiterate  I m exaggerating  I seriously thought 401 k  marathon  Not I really needed know much money recently  For life I didn t any  knowing investment plans  stocks bonds would relatively pointless  My credit score nonexistent  But I started making money standup  lack education really cost me  literally figuratively  I spent money impulsively I gave money whoever asked  It going pretty well  I thought  one parents got sick without health insurance  All sudden I needed money I ever spent shoes  fancy juices  people s problems  I remember sitting ICU  feeling terrified I couldn t afford help medical bills  also feeling trapped  In moment  I realized I looking money wrong  It finally clicked money freedom  Until point  I didn t know way I managed net worth reflection self worth  What I spent money either positive negative contribution future safety  sanity  ability feel free  To change way I thought money  I started substituting word  money  word  freedom  This helped make previously difficult financial decisions way easier   made ones used easy way harder  For example  I wondering putting money 401 k  I m always hesitant I want see money account now  I d ask  Should I put freedom 401 k  I freedom I get older  All sudden  no brainer  If someone asked money  I d ask  Should I give freedom friend shows signs wanting get life together earning freedom  keeps asking freedom  So much loan  Or I couldn t decide I wanted buy something not  I d ask  Are new jeans worth two hundred units current freedom  Luckily  I ve come across literally zero pairs pants I value much free  I have  however  found couple wireless bras I do  But give another kind freedom   perhaps that s shelling makes feel like I m breaking even  Whitney Cummings comedian  actress co creator 2 Broke Girls  Her book I m Fine And Other Lies week

text: How Much Would You Make You Were Man  Take interactive quiz find President Barack Obama revisiting issue marked beginning presidency  Equal pay men women  On Jan  29  seven years day Obama signed effect Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act  acknowledged wage gap still persists alarming degree and introduced several new measures help address problem  One efforts proposal increase amount data men every age range  15  less ages 22 25 staggering 38  less ages 51 64  We analyzed wages earned 15 million Americans surveyed Census Bureau 2008 2012  classified 460 different occupational categories  We found 372 occupations contained enough information determine statistically significant gender pay gap least one seven age ranges examined  In all  found 1 490 combinations age occupation existed statistically significant difference much men women make  Only 22 1 490 involved women making money men  All 22 situations women out earned men occurred among youngest cohorts occupation   The gaps statistically significant least 90  level confidence  threshold Census uses  There single occupation women age 30 took home significantly higher average salaries male colleagues  even start making much more  Looking earning patterns secondary school teachers helps tell story  From ages 22 25  women actually earn 10  male colleagues  By time teachers turn 30  statistical difference male peers  By 35  men make more  It s pattern see repeated librarians  social workers  secretaries preschool teachers  Notably  female dominated professions  In male dominated professions like engineering finance  women typically make less start  Some occupations stand particularly egregious research  For example  tax preparation industry  sample 5 000 people  one worst records pay disparity job country  From ages 26 30  female tax preparers  average  earn around half much male counterparts  It gets worse there  Among 41 50  women tax preparation business bring home third much male colleagues  One explanation pay disparity many occupations offer higher  lower paying tracks  We could hypothesize  instance  female lawyers choose public service male lawyers choose high paying firms  perhaps explaining male lawyers 40s earn 51  female counterparts  But sheer breadth occupations men make women suggests something self selection tracks  For instance  male dishwashers 50s paid 20  female dishwashers  Male janitors 40s paid 63  more  Joining profession women make majority workers may give women pay advantage either or even parity  There research show female dominated professions  men get promoted quickly women field  effect termed  glass escalator  Male female registered nurses  research shows  make roughly pay youngest cohorts  significant wage gap open 30s beyond  The survey confirm men women certain high paying professions  financial analysts  dentists  women certain low paying professions  teaching assistants  telemarketers  But within professions  men still make significantly more  Having women higher paying professions  words  would eliminate overall gap  Some point fact women remain primary caregivers many families cause wages lagging behind men  A woman might leave work force raise child returns enter lower wage never catch up  While may happen places  childcare alone cannot account vast inequality measured across almost every profession age group  The calculations analysis exclude anyone earn income  include part time workers  While men work part time still tend earn women work part time  occupations age cohorts female part timers outnumber male part timers  This could explain gap groups  cannot explain all  Researchers found among full time workers still intractable gap  even controlling things like occupational segregation employment gaps due maternity childcare  Alarmingly  discrimination happens promotion season job candidate first shows company  In variety professions  male dominated female dominated  experiments title: Poll  Biden leads Trump prospective 2020 matchup
text: Former U S  Vice President Joe Biden   Scott Olson Getty Images Poll  Biden leads Trump prospective 2020 matchup Only 35 percent voters would choose reelect Trump 2020  poll shows  WASHINGTON   Former Vice President Joe Biden would lead President Donald Trump 2020 general election  according new POLITICO Morning Consult poll  Only 35 percent voters would choose reelect Trump 2020  poll shows vote generic Democrat Trump  78 percent Democrats say prefer Biden Trump  Independent voters tilt away incumbent  41 percent would vote Biden  26 percent Trump  POLITICO reported last week Biden has  recent months   shifted unmistakably favor running  president 2020  And former vice president Delaware senator media blitz promote new book   Promise Me  Dad  A Year Hope  Hardship  Purpose  released title: We going kill you  Villagers Burma recount violence Rohingya Muslim militants
text: In port city Sittwe western Burma  monks public officials deny atrocities committed military  refugees recount tales killings Rohingya militants   Annie Gowen The Washington Post  The Hindu woman wept vowed never return home  said Rohingya militants slaughtered son  daughter in law three granddaughters August   They killed family  Halu Bar Hla  70  said tears camp internally displaced people western Burma   I go back  I die I go back village  They slit throat  Hla s account illustrates complexity Rohingya crisis  Buddhists minorities Hindus claim militant Rohingya carried atrocities even brutal military  clearance operation  sent 600 000 Rohingya Muslims across border Bangladesh  The U N  human rights chief called Burmese military s crackdown  textbook example ethnic cleansing  Burma s democratically elected government Aung San Suu Kyi  de facto leader  widely condemned exodus  Secretary State Rex Tillerson met Suu Kyi early Wednesday Burma  At joint briefing meeting  Tillerson said concerned  credible reports widespread atrocities committed  Burma s  security forces vigilantes  He said United States consider targeted sanctions individuals advise broad based economic sanctions time  The Burmese military issued internal report week exonerated soldiers wrongdoing  Interviews monks  politicians refugees port city demonstrate difficult Burmese Bangladeshi officials come plan Rohingya return Rakhine state  Leaders Buddhist community Suu Kyi s government deny atrocities Rohingya taken place all  saying refugees fled fear Rohingya militants attacked police posts late August   The extremists incited villagers go away saying Burma army would come kill them  They killed Hindus ethnic minorities  We could find death Muslim  said Win Htein  top adviser Suu Kyi   There genocide ethnic cleansing  Sittwe close journalists freely get northern Rakhine state  sealed military  militants attacked Aug  25  Behind military cordon  violence ebbed  Villagers aid workers allowed entry area describe ghostly scenes burned Rohingya villages  largely devoid people  Estimates vary  100 000 200 000 Rohingya remain  food medical supplies running low   Even destruction  see bicycle that s left  It s strange feeling  life stopped  The sense emptiness quite striking  said Fabrizio Carboni  head Burma delegation International Committee Red Cross  Red Cross groups   outside aid workers permitted enter   distributed food cash assistance 86 000 since late August  A Rohingya grocer town Maungdaw said telephone security tight Rohingya permitted travel   We re trapped surrounded military  said Ko Hla Win  34  They surviving Buddhists secretly selling food  said  Elsewhere  state workers began harvesting 70 000 acres rice paddies Rohingya left behind  spokesman said  They also preparing two camps house returning refugees  Muslim Rohingya refugees fleeing persecution Burma cross border Bangladesh Oct  16 video released United Nations High Commissioner Refugees   UNHCR  It two months since August attacks triggered crackdown left 280 villages burned   according Human Rights Watch analysis satellite photos   scores dead  Survivors alleged widespread human rights violations military  including rapes mass executions  Witness accounts difficult verify government denied U N  human rights investigators others access area  The exodus riveted international attention plight 1 million Rohingya Muslims long denied citizenship basic rights Burma  majority Buddhist nation 51 million people Southeast Asia also known Myanmar  The country held largely democratic elections 2015  military still controls security  key ministries lucrative state owned enterprises  At time Rohingya fled  30 000 Hindus  Buddhists ethnic minorities also displaced  fleeing south Sittwe take refuge monasteries  In interviews  displaced villagers said afraid return home feared Rohingya insurgents whose attacks police posts villages precipitated crisis  The port city Sittwe western Burma closest place journalists travel freely conflict ridden area 600 000 fled   Annie Gowen The Washington Post  In years since Burma became independent Britain 1948  country s military regime gradually diminished rights Rohingya  stripping citizenship right vote  Today government considers Rohingya illegal immigrants Bangladesh  called  Bengalis  here  slur  Kalar  Even term  Rohingya  anathema  Suu Kyi won t use inflammatory  told The Washington Post interview last year  In 2012  rape Buddhist woman Rohingya men triggered widespread communal violence 100 000 Rohingya Salvation Army  ARSA  according December report International Crisis Group  Its leaders eventually traveled area recruit surreptitiously train villagers guerrilla war tactics  report said title: The ultimate guide first stress free Thanksgiving
text: Simple Roast Turkey With Simplest Gravy  see recipe  below   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  Maybe it s first time cooking Thanksgiving  Or maybe you re hoping first time you ll prepare without inviting stress kitchen  too  Whatever case  I meal   along strategies back up  This lineup feels familiar jaded  best all  it s simple prepare   No need start countdown 18 days advance  My menu offers flavors memories traditional meal recipes hard mess   won t crowd oven  At end day  Thanksgiving winning awards tackled complicated  intimidating set recipes  Worrying  particularly something easily control  way anyone wants spend Thanksgiving  or day  matter  Instead  follow advice  mind set calm welcoming  That s godsend  important part meal isn t actually what s table  chance connect people sitting around it  reflect gratitude  Jump recipes  Here s set things right track beginning  starting planning  Roasted Sweet Potatoes With Sour Cream   Toasted Pumpkin Seeds let avoid pitfalls mashed potatoes   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  1  Keep scope meal small manageable  Choose carefully  You don t tick every box  Just so and so grew two types stuffing another guest waxes poetic three desserts doesn t mean make them  You nostalgic flavors handful simple dishes  Besides  fewer dishes  easier calculations many servings make   My selection recipes adds plentiful meal eight  they re easily scalable  Skip prepared appetizers  They fill everyone meal  anyhow  Instead  serve drinks bowls peanuts pistachios   perhaps whole radishes  olives  cornichons jarred marinated artichoke hearts  Forget cocktails  unless can t imagine Thanksgiving without one  Stick beer  wine nonalcoholic beverages apple cider sparkling water  If want cocktail  make one pitcher drink punch don t play bartender  2  Decide delegate  Some good candidates    Drinks and or ice   By way  cold porch  that s great place put drinks make room fridge   kitchen    The table setting  Ask someone bring miniature pumpkins and or clementines  set rest guests arrive   Or consider days advance  pumpkins clementines sit days without wilting needing water    Cranberry sauce   Or buy stuff can  many people love    Dessert   If want make it  though  read easy  delicious idea    Final prep help  Brown Butter Green Beans blanched day meal warmed browned butter serving time   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  3  Cook everything turkey day before  This renders moot question prepare multiple dishes they re ready time  Two side dishes dessert bake temperature  maximum timing flexibility    A simple bread stuffing   reheated serving    Green beans   warm nutty browned butter mealtime    Roasted sweet potatoes   rewarmed  split  dolloped sour cream topped crunchy pumpkin seeds   This allows avoid mashed potato pitfalls peeling  chopping uneven reheating    Apple gingerbread cake  good  better  sits day  involves rolling pie dough  mixer frosting  The turkey turns beautifully brining  basting marinating   Deb Lindsey  For The Washington Post  4  Think turkey big chicken skip fuss  Don t brine  baste  marinate stuff  Simply season generously salt  add water pan  roast couple hours  I like set little rack made celery  helps circulate air underneath it  plus gives yummy celery  But even this  skip  Buy least five days advance  If it s fresh  last week fridge  If it s frozen  stay way months  needs 24 hours defrosting refrigerator every 4 pounds  So 12  14 pound bird I call feed eight people  start defrosting Saturday safe   You defrost size bird nine hours sink container filled cold water  you ll change water every half hour  Once turkey defrosted  remove giblets neck they re included save stock  Let turkey rest roasts least 20 minutes  Really  It makes difference bird s juiciness  Make easy gravy doesn t require intimidating roux run risk getting lumpy  While turkey rests  whisk sour cream pan juices  It couldn t easier  result tastes like pure cold water let simmer you re eating  at least two hours  ideally four  Later  strain stock use soup next day  Add whatever turkey leftover plus cooked rice barley eat topped grated cheese parsley title: Ancient fossil forest discovered Antarctica
text: Antarctica wasn t always land ice  Millions years ago  continent still part huge Southern Hemisphere landmass called Gondwana  trees flourished near South Pole  Now  newfound  intricate fossils different  much greener place  The climate warmer  though plants survived low southern latitudes cope winters 24 hour per day darkness summers sun never set  today  Gulbranson team focused era centered around 252 million years ago  Permian Triassic mass extinction  During event  many 95 percent Earth s species died out  The extinction probably driven massive greenhouse gas emissions volcanoes  raised planet s temperatures extreme levels caused oceans acidify  scientists found  There obvious parallels contemporary climate change  Gulbranson said  less extreme similarly driven greenhouse gases  Prior end Permian mass extinction  southern polar forests dominated one type tree  Glossopteris genus  Gulbranson told Live Science  These behemoths grew 65 131 feet  20 40 meters  tall  broad  flat leaves longer person s forearm  Gulbranson said  Before Permian extinction  Glossopteris dominated landscape 35th parallel south South Pole   The 35th parallel south circle latitude crosses two landmasses  southern tip South American southern tip Australia  Before Last year  fossil hunting Antarctica  Gulbranson team found oldest polar forest record southern polar region  They haven t dated forest precisely yet  probably flourished 280 million years ago rapidly buried volcanic ash  preserved cellular level  researchers said  Erik Gulbranson On Thanksgiving Day  Gulbranson return Antarctica excavations two sites  Those sites contain fossils period spanning Permian extinction  After extinction  Gulbranson said  forests didn t disappear  changed  Glossopteris out  new mix preserved rock amino acid building blocks made trees  proteins still extracted  said Gulbranson  specializes geochemistry techniques  Studying chemical building blocks may help clarify trees handled southern latitudes  weird sunlight conditions  well factors allowed plants thrive drove Glossopteris death  said  This season  field team access helicopters  land closer rugged outcrops Transantarctic Mountains fossil forests found  The team  members hail United States  Germany  Argentina  Italy France  camp months time  hitching helicopter rides outcrops fickle Antarctic weather allows  The 24 title: Man finds unlikely friendship driver left paralyzed
text: David Platillero riding bike class Blackbird Academy music school Nashville  Tennessee  got terrible accident would change life  A year half ago  driver ran red light crashed 24 year old  Platillero cracked head windshield launched air   I told body went 10 feet air landed pavement 100 feet away  Platillero  goes stage name David Francisco  told CBS News   I don t remember it  The thing remember waking hospital gown arm splint legs propped up  covered bandages  David Platillero The hospital notified parents accident son s serious injuries  They drove 100 miles Knoxville  Tennessee  side  doctors Vanderbilt University Medical Center prepared worst   The arm last concerns  David s father  John  recalled orthopedic surgeon telling phone   He severe spinal cord injury   It s like worst call could possibly get  David Platillero said   They told I never going walk again  For 10 days  lay hospital bed thinking injuries   I cried every day  said Who would want marry someone   would want someone like who s dependent people  It sad  David Platillero But also worried woman hit him  He never stopped asking her   From I told  really distraught whole thing  Platillero said   She crying  I didn t want life ruined this  Platillero wanted get touch offer forgiveness   It sounds like accident  said  For five months  underwent physical therapy Shepherd Center Atlanta  Platillero searched driver  later discovered 23 year old Freya Markowski  Then one day  got text  It began   Dear David   I lost soul accident  Markowski wrote   I want know day goes without crying pain   I realized was  Platillero said   It incredible I remember thinking I ve got sit actually respond this  Platillero replied video walking braces harness   Whoa  that s awesome  Markowski replied  The pair kept touch  texting video chatting least month  Platillero told Markowski progress physical therapy  In return  Markowski told struggles   diagnosed bipolar struggled addiction  Markowski didn t use drugs day accident  also hadn t taking medication treat bipolar disorder  Nashville newspaper The Tennessean reports   The enemy drug  her  Platillero said  David Platillero In October 2016  six months accident  Platillero s dad attended hearing Markowski faced charges failure yield causing serious injury   I told him   Let s press charges  See say whatever would best her  David Platillero said   We didn t think prison going good someone already many things happen  Markowski shocked  The charges dropped   I thought I going jail day  Instead angel man shows open arms  David s dad gave really big hug  Markowski told The Tennessean   How possible  The dad guy I paralyzed  Last spring  nearly year accident  Platillero Markowski decided meet local coffee shop  Platillero stepped car crutches  Markowski began tear up   She thought I going come wheelchair  Platillero said   We hugged maybe thirty seconds  without saying word  Markowski expressed sorrow apologized  Platillero finally told he d waiting say person year   I forgive you  He continues update Markowski progress monthly  He s slowly regaining movement legs  He walk assistance crutches  still doesn t bowel bladder function   Everything waist isn t gone  I don t think ever same  Platillero said   I m still getting stronger  working every day  I m thankful things I have  Platillero inspired write several songs rehab  even helped create documentary film called  Back Blackbird  narrates road recovery  He recently moved Los Angeles pursue career music  But doesn t mean he s forgotten Markowski  In fact  invited wedding February   We still talk frequently  Platillero said   We ll always weird bond

students drop out  landmark study convinced many educators course failure matters most  In 2005  researchers University Chicago examined records thousands students entered Chicago public high schools 1999  They found 81 percent students completed ninth grade without failing course ended graduating four years later  For students failed one classes  on time graduation rate plummeted 22 percent   It title: Btp chiudono stabili 30 anni calo  spread amplia su rialzo Bund
text: MILANO  Reuters    In chiusura Btp cedono il terreno guadagnato nella seduta per assestarsi attorno alla parit  ad eccezione del trentennale che mostra invece un accenno di debolezza vista dell offerta sul versante extralungo da parte della Spagna domattina  Un operatore lavoro  REUTERS Lucas Jackson   Sulla scia del rialzo del Bund  lo spread con la Germania evidenzia un ampliamento  Un riallineamento tecnico  quello del Bund  dopo sedute cui ha fatto meglio il Btp determinando un restringimento del differenziale fra tassi dei decennali di riferimento che la scorsa settimana era arrivato 136 punti base  il minimo da ottobre 2016    Dopo l Italia  che ha archiviato la regolare tornata d aste di met mese con le riaperture per gli specialisti di ieri  e la Germania  che fra ieri e oggi ha collocato il nuovo Schatz e una riapertura del decennale  domani si attiveranno sul primario Francia e Spagna  Parigi offre fra 4 e 5 miliardi di euro di Oat nominali con scadenza 2020  2023  2025  oltre 1 5 2 miliardi su tre indicizzati  Madrid mette sul piatto fra 4 e 5 miliardi di euro dei titoli 2021  2022  2027 e 2066    Stamane sul primario si sono dunque affacciate la Germania e il Portogallo  La prima con il collocamento di 2 475 miliardi del Bund decennale agosto 2027 con un tasso calo allo 0 36  un asta tecnicamente scoperta  Lisbona si  invece attivata sul fronte brevissimo col collocamento di 400 milioni di titoli 6 mesi e 1 1 miliardi di titoli 12 mesi    Chiusa oggi   con una richiesta che non raggiunge 4 miliardi di euro complessivi   l offerta agli investitori retail del nuovo Btp Italia novembre 2023  si terr domattina l offerta agli investitori istituzionali  Il primo giorno di offerta al retail si era chiuso con una domanda pari 2 186 miliardi  il secondo per 1 139 miliardi  Sul sito www reuters it altre notizie Reuters italiano  Le top news anche su www twitter com reuters_italia

text: HARARE  Reuters    When came power  Zimbabwe s Robert Mugabe feted African liberation hero nation endured nearly century white colonial rule  Zimbabwe President Robert Mugabe attends launch educated Jesuit priests worked primary school teacher going South Africa s University Fort Hare  breeding ground African nationalism  Returning Rhodesia 1960  entered politics jailed decade four years political enemies  boasted another qualification    a degree violence  After long bush war ended  Mugabe elected nation s first black prime minister  Initially  offered reconciliation old adversaries presided booming economy  LIBERATION RIVAL But long Mugabe began suppress challengers liberation war rival Joshua Nkomo  Faced revolt mid 1980s western province Matabeleland blamed Nkomo  Mugabe sent North Korean trained army units  provoking international outcry alleged atrocities civilians  Human rights groups say 20 000 people died  Nkomo s Ndebele tribe  The discovery mass graves prompted economies  collapse agricultural foreign exchange earnings unleashing hyperinflation  The economy shrank third 2000 2008  sending unemployment 80 percent  Several million Zimbabweans fled  mostly South Africa  An unapologetic Mugabe portrayed radical African nationalist competing racist imperialist forces Washington London  Britain likened Adolf Hitler Mugabe mind  saying Nazi leader wanted justice  sovereignty independence people   If Hitler  let Hitler ten fold  ROCK BOTTOM The country hit rock bottom 2008  500 billion percent inflation drove people support challenge Western backed former union leader Morgan Tsvangirai  Facing defeat presidential run off  Mugabe resorted violence  forcing Tsvangirai withdraw scores supporters killed ZANU PF thugs  An increasingly worried South title: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  signaling potential thaw
text: China send special envoy North Korea Friday  days President Trump s visit Asia  Chinese North Korean state media announced Wednesday  marking potential diplomatic thaw Pyongyang Beijing  The announcement closely follows President Trump s Tuesday departure Asia 13 day trip North Korea topped agenda  Chinese President Xi Jinping send special envoy Song Tao  head China s ruling Communist Party s International Liaison Department  Pyongyang  according announcement  Trump made pressuring China centerpiece strategy thwart North Korea s ambition developing ability launch nuclear strike continental U S  In Beijing last week  pressured Xi work  very hard  issue  Xi  turn   stated upping sanctions  North Korea  Trump tweeted Saturday   The optimistic spin Donald Trump got Chinese Korea   But it s probably information sharing   North Koreans want know what s going on   The timing strongly suggests response Trump trip  continued   But past American presidents pushed China North Korea before  China s never come around  Song  envoy   inform  North Korea s leadership outcome 19th Party Congress  major political conclave Beijing last month appointed Xi second five year term  China s official New China News Agency reported  Song visited Vietnam Laos  fellow Communist states  mission following congress  At regular briefing Wednesday  Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Geng Shuang said Song intends debrief North Korean leaders congress  He declined specify whether envoy would also discuss Pyongyang s nuclear ambitions   During visit  exchange views major issues common concern  Geng said  China North Korea s main ally trading partner  accounting 90  isolated state s trade volume  Yet China North Korea relations deteriorated recent months  Beijing rattled Pyongyang s recent string missile tests   country conducted 15 since February   nuclear test September  occurred hours Xi s introductory speech major international summit southeast China  No ministerial level Chinese official visited North Korea since 2015  Liu Yunshan  member all powerful Politburo Standing Committee  met Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un Pyongyang  Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Liu Zhenmin visited Pyongyang October 2016  Few details either visit made public  North Korea tested missile two months  China pledged enforce latest round United Nations Security Council sanctions  approved text: The two defendants appeared court scarves wrapped around heads  partially obscuring faces  One young women spoke animatedly  hands awhirl bantered lawyers recess  Her relaxed demeanor belied Jong Nam  estranged half brother North Korean leader Kim Jong Un  died shortly afterward autopsy concluded exposure lethal nerve agent VX  Defense lawyers say women  pleaded guilty  dupes North Korean plot assassinate Kim Jong Nam thought participating made for TV prank  Four North Korean men  prosecutors called co conspirators  remain large flown Kuala Lumpur airport day women encountered Kim  CCTV footage played court month showed men entering restrooms poisoning reemerging  clothes changed  The grainy videos could key case women  two defendants trial case  They face death hanging convicted  As trial unfolds Shah Alam  south Kuala Lumpur  broader repercussions taking shape  The case added pariah reputation Kim Jong Un  presumed orchestrated half brother s killing reasons remain unclear  If killing politically motivated   defense lawyers argued  hoping clients exonerated   represented ominous signal isolated Pyongyang government could target enemies foreign soil might hesitate use deadly toxin crowded public place  It also badly damaged North Korea s ties Malaysia  one countries could consider friendly  Malaysia one two dozen countries maintain embassy North Korea  year governments allowed citizens travel country without visas  But Kim Jong Nam s death  North Korea blocked Malaysian diplomats families leaving country six weeks Kuala Lumpur allowed Kim s corpse flown Pyongyang  Malaysia bowed North Korean demands release three North Korean citizens hiding embassy Kuala Lumpur  Two three   embassy official employee state owned airline Air Koryo   seen airport footage Feb  13 played court month  Malaysian police said March taken statements two longer needed investigation  The standoff humiliation Malaysia widened bilateral rift  analysts said   I doubt  the including ban citizens traveling North Korea recalling ambassador Pyongyang  Malaysia s relative affluence makes magnet estimated 4 million economic migrants Southeast Asian countries  The defendants poisoning case hail rural areas Indonesia Vietnam  countries per capita income less half Malaysia s  According defense lawyers  Aisyah Huong know identity man targeting   thought merely taking part title: Mother s boyfriend guilty murder torture death 8 year old Palmdale boy
text: A 37 year old man accused torturing beating girlfriend s 8 year old son death case prompted far reaching reforms county s child welfare system convicted Wednesday first degree murder  Jurors text: Jacopo Prisco   CNN Written In 1920s  French art collector Pierre Vrit began building   almost secret   one world s impressive stashes African Oceanic masterpieces  And years developed equally hallmarks traditional  Kona  style  including wrestler like posture broad eight shaped mouth display aggressiveness  The figurine closely resembles piece British Museum s collection   acquired London text: Russia gave Venezuela big break debt payments  It s latest sign two nations deepening ties Trump administration cracks Venezuela  The Kremlin announced agreed restructure  3 15 billion debt title: The Muslim Overpopulation Myth That Just Won t Die
text: The trope Muslim overpopulation reliably powerful anywhere world sizable Muslim immigrant minority population  India Western Europe  Hindu nationalists often fan anxiety Muslim population growth  proportion Muslims India grew 0 8 percent 2001 2011  14 2 percent   If remains situation  one forget existence one s country 2025  said leader major Hindu nationalist organization last year  But fertility gap Muslims Hindus India narrowing fast  greatest birthrate disparities states  religions  Hindu women poor state Bihar two children Muslim women developed Andhra Pradesh  Similar concerns echo across countries like France  Germany  U K  Netherlands  Although Muslims make less 10 percent total population countries  perceived overpopulation center anti immigration discourse  About 7 5 percent France Muslim  yet average French people believe Muslims constitute one three people country  Although Muslim women Western Europe currently children non Muslim counterparts  research shows European Muslims  fertility rate also declining much faster  fertility rates likely converge time   However  context  fertility isn t issue  wave Muslim immigration past years reinforced Europeans  concerns Muslim population growth  Why overpopulation myth persist worldwide  even though it s typically demonstrably false  like Burma  nowhere near epidemic proponents assert  like Europe India  It s true global Muslim population growing  fast  But it s growing speed across regions  And trope seems power Muslim populations actually growing fastest like sub Saharan Africa but places culturally distinct minorities  There s nothing inherent Islam link higher fertility in fact  it s particularly natalist  pro birth  religion  Eight nine classic schools Islamic law permit contraception  Many Muslim states  including Pakistan  supported family planning  The growth global Muslim population was  according 2011 Pew Center report  due  youth bulge an unusually high number young Muslim people  peaked around 2000  higher overall fertility rate Muslim women group  On latter point  major takeaway Pew report  and companion year  fertility much less religion much economics  social services  women s empowerment  conflict  The fertility rate across 49 Muslim majority countries fell 4 3 children per woman 1990 95 2 9 2010 15  This still higher global fertility rate 2015  it s strikingly fast drop given fact took Western European countries nearly century transition six children per woman three  The claim Muslim overpopulation falls apart fascinating ways examined closely  The fastest fertility drop modern history happened Islamic theocracy Iran  In 1950  Iranian women seven children each  today 1 68  fewer Americans  What changed  In 1989  country s leaders realized high birth rate straining young republic  In response  Supreme Leader issued fatwas encouraging birth control contraception  Health Ministry propagated family planning counseling  rural health centers  contraceptive distribution across country  Iran also made girls  education development priority sought rebuild civil society Iran Iraq War  ended 1988  girls ever started attend  strictly gender segregated  schools  Everywhere  inverse relationship years schooling fertility rates  The Muslim overpopulation myth likely counterproductive propagators  In world s largest Muslim majority country  Indonesia  fertility rates dropped 1960s 1990s  5 6 children per woman 2 3  Suharto dictatorship instituted vigorous  centralized family planning program made improvements girls  education  Those government services decentralized democracy came archipelago 1998 and  predictably  fertility rates creeping again  Today  Indonesia s majority Christian less developed eastern provinces higher birthrate developed  Muslim majority western ones a testament correlation economic development fertility

existence 30 them  But doesn t mean discoveries boring  A rocky planet similar size temperature Earth orbiting nearby star called Ross 128  astronomers announced Wednesday  The star red dwarf  type star smaller cooler stars like sun  located 11 light years solar system  This makes planet  named Ross 128 b  second closest temperate  Earth sized planet little corner universe  The closest Proxima b  resides four light years away habitable zone Proxima Centauri  nearest star  discovered last year  Ross 128 b found ESO s High Accuracy Radial Velocity Planet Searcher  HARPS  instrument located La Silla Observatory Chile  discovery described paper Astronomy Astrophysics  Astronomers HARPS spent 10 years gathering refining data  included 160 measurements Ross 128  found signal turned exoplanet  said Xavier Bonfils  paper s lead author  astronomer Institut de Plantologie et d Astrophysique de Grenoble France   To detect small signal requires lot data  Bonfils said  Stars like Ross 128 move ever slightly gravitational tug nearby objects  These tiny movements seen changes star s light spectrum  star moves toward observer in case  HARPS instrument its light looks slightly bluer  moves away  turns redder  If shifts occur regular patterns  means there s exoplanet lurking  Astronomers analyze information determine planet s properties  Nicola Astudillo Defru  astronomer University Geneva Bonfils s coauthor  said reacted  a big wow  data showed rocky temperate world   I feel excited I mailed Xavier minutes later clear URGENT subject  said email   Nearby exoplanets particularly exciting SETI perspective  Astronomers say Ross 128 b completes orbit around star every 9 9 days  They estimate exoplanet equilibrium temperature somewhere  60 degrees 20 degrees Celsius  76 degrees 68 degrees Fahrenheit  Astronomers don t know whether Ross 128 b resides star system s habitable zone  sweet spot temperatures right liquid water pool surface rocky world  But they re still hopeful might able support life  Red dwarfs like Ross 128 dimmer sun like stars  emitting infrared instead visible light  So Ross 128 orbits 20 times closer star Earth sun  exoplanet receives 1 38 times stellar radiation Earth  Bonfils said Ross 128  quieter  red dwarfs  like Proxima Centauri  unleash flares bathe orbiting planets ultraviolet X ray radiation

title: Bill Clinton  A Reckoning
text: The remarkable thing current tide sexual assault harassment accusations number  If every woman America started talking things happen course ordinary female life  would never end  Nor power men involved  History instructs us countless men  ability possess women sexually spoil power  it s point power  What s remarkable women believed  Most don t police reports witnesses physical evidence them  Moreover  finally come kind national consensus workplace  naturally fosters level romance flirtation  line impulses sexual predation boss clear  Related Stories All Angry Ladies In Valley Open allegations Clarence Thomas  1991  When came forward Thomas s Supreme Court confirmation hearing reported sexually humiliated pressured throughout tenure boss Equal Employment Opportunity Commission  event convulsive national anxiety  Here black man  Republican  appointed Supreme Court  black woman  presumably liberal  trying block reports repeated  squalid  vividly recounted episodes sexual harassment  She little evidence support accusations  Many believed since she d lawyer EEOC  uniquely qualified handled harassment  But something one could predicted happened  It pre Twitter  pre internet  highly analog version  MeToo  To surprise millions men  nation turned full women of political stripes socioeconomic backgrounds who d put Hell work  Mothers  sisters  aunts  girlfriends  wives millions women shared experience wait tables  draw blood  argue cases  make sales  fending groping  joking  sexual pressuring  threatening male bosses  They liberal conservative  white collar pink collar  black white Hispanic Asian  Their common experience political  economic  racial  Their common experience female  For reason  response dramatic hearings constituted one great truly tracks  How vitiated Bill Clinton seemed 2016 Democratic convention  Some appetites  least  waned  wandering   Norwegian Wood  speech wife struck nostalgic notes husband s 50th anniversary toast now  He won t get messes again  Yet let us forget sex crimes younger  stronger Bill Clinton credibly accused 1990s  Juanita Broaddrick reported volunteer one gubernatorial campaigns  arranged meet hotel coffee shop  At last minute  changed location room hotel  says violently raped her  She said fought Clinton throughout rape left bloodied  At different Arkansas hotel  caught sight minor state
